properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  Park at the end of Thurman at the base of the entrance to Forest Park to begin some amazing running and hiking trails on leif erikson.

properties.name: !st hole in one - par 3 3rd hole - 167 yards
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr1st hole in one! 9 iron. This hole plays VERY VERY short. Hit your shot long because it will spin back on this green at least 5 yards. Dont be short right, since you tee off from so high, any shot there is buried!

properties.name: 12 foot pipe (now underground)
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrFrontside slasher in a now underground cement pipe by Bennington in Colonel Sanders Park in Portland Oregon. Pic by Garland.

Posted by IoftigrBrady Lynch mini ramp12 foot wide with an extension that once started out as a very ramp. It was skated by such locals as Jordan Geis, Buddy Nichols, Bret Taylor, bennington, and blessed by the entire JAKS team (that was scary for the neighborhood)!!!!!

properties.name: 1st eagle on par 4 - Hole 1 - OGA players course
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr9 iron from fairway bunker to dunk in 2002 OGA mens stroke play tournament

properties.name: 5 stair plus sidewalk gap into parking lot
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigrgreat 5 stair plus sidewalk gapHave fun!

properties.name: 8 foot grass gap
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrGregory Heights Grass Gapif you are man enough. yes i certainly did land that - maybe not that exact one. also a 180 kflip varial.

properties.name: Aaron Campbell's summer home
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrNortons old mini rampMini-ramp home to Torrey Greenwood, Aaron Campbell and other vancouver locals. WHy does bennington put his pic on every single old skatespot?

properties.name: Apotheke
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 1314 Nw Glisan St, Portland, ORWalk upstairs to this small interesting bar and enjoy the company of friends with an amazing beer selection (100+) and always a dj and cool people. Often times a fun event going on, from a fashion show, to a party with local designers. Hit & Miss.

properties.name: Bamboo Garden Nursery
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr   18900 NW Collins Road 97133Need bamboo and dont have time to go through the poor bamboo selection at the wholesale flower market - here is the place to go!!!!!!!!!!

properties.name: Derby Park
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr     508 Woodland Way Santa Cruz, CAOne of the oldest and coolest skateparks ever. Think we spilled some beer on the pic.

properties.name: Earliest to open Starbucks
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr This starbucks opens at 5am, so if you need to get something to go on a VERY early morning in downtown, this is the place to go.

properties.name: First Unitarian Church
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr1011 SW 12th PortlandThey\'\'re mission: tocreate a welcoming community of diverse individuals; to promote love, reason, and freedom in religion; to foster lifelong spiritual growth; and to act for social justice.

properties.name: First pipe I ever skated
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrThe first pipe I ever skated. Bennington circa 1984. Pic by Brady Lynch.

properties.name: Fuller's Coffee Shop
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  136 Nw 9th Ave, Portland, ORA Portland landmark! In the center of the pearl is a remarkable find! This old school diner has been around for decades and serves great cheap food. The first to open for breakfast in the Pearl!!!! Try the country fried steak with eggs, hasbrowns and toast.

properties.name: Genie - by Tom Bass 1973
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  Queen Victoria Gardens metal sculpture - Melbourne AustraliaOne of many pieces of public art in the Queen Victoria Gardens in Melbourne on the Yarra river.

properties.name: Heathman Hotel Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr   1001 SW Broadway 97205Wonderful chef and food. Exceptionally wonderful (top 5) places to go for Sunday Brunch. Also, a delightful High Tea - call for availability and reservations.

properties.name: Home of 2005 PICA landmark event
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrPICA celebrated ten years of service to the arts community of Portland with its Landmark dinner in this old pearl district warehouse. It soon will be converted to the Aveda spa and training facility in 2006.

properties.name: Jake going big backside
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrOld Skatespot - Intern house vert rampNo longer available vert ramp. Home to Jake Olsen, Mike R, and company.

properties.name: Keihl's
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  712 NW 23rd Ave, Portland, 97210Need you say more? Kiehl\'\'s portland store that opened in 2004. Has the complete line of products for men, women, and baby!

properties.name: Kelsall Chiropractic
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 1615 NW 23rd 97210Wonderful offices of Dr. Karen Kelsall and staff. The have taken care of me for the past two years and have been wonderful. Highly recommended! Enter in the back!

properties.name: Kona Skatepark
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  8739 Kona Ave - Jacksonville, FL 32211Photo attached was taken when skated by Bennington in 1983.

properties.name: Langdon Farms Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  24377 NE Airport Road Aurora, OR 97002Well kept but not incredibly difficult golf course. Drains very well in the winter - you will never find a puddle in the fairway here!

properties.name: Little Jimmys camp
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr38105 SE GOrdon Creek Road 97019Home of the big jimmys skateboard camp. This pic featuring a 6 person leap was a the clincher as this skater manhandled the rough indoor barn surface and took home first place. SATAN SATAN!!!!!!!!! Rebel rules!

properties.name: Lovejoy Parking garage
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrPlenty of places to skate under here including a bank to wall, and some curbs. Dare to try it now!!!

properties.name: Maplewood School back playground
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr   7313 sw 52nd avenue portland 97219Site of the first ever Bionic Dragonz skateboard contest in 1986, attended by Danny Sergeant, Tyrone Talbert, Adam Muzikant. Bennington got 4th. Sergeant dropped in on a 12 stair square wooden handrail and almost died. Yes that is a ramp made with firelogs. Yes, that is a rob roskopp board.

properties.name: Masu
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr   Great place for sushi or drinks. Enter on 13th and walk upstairs.

properties.name: NE restaurant row
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr A number of very good restaurants are on this side of the street including Tabla, Taqueria Nueve, and Navarre. Make sure to try the Mole at TN - it is one of if not the best in Portland. The 0 special at Tabla is a steal!

properties.name: New Renaissance Bookstore
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 1338 NW 23rd Av, Portland, Oregon 97210This bookstore sells products that reflect the values of balance, good health and abundance to promote a holistic, spiritual and joyous lifestyle.

properties.name: Nimbus Banks
properties.description: Posted by JasonThe entire industrial park is filled with smooth loading dock banks, some mellow, some steep. Not sure it\'s still a skateable.

properties.name: OMSI Boardwalk
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrGreat place to take a stroll on the river while gaining a good view of Downtown Portland from the east side of the Willamette River. Also a good place to take skate pics with the red glow of the OMSI sign.

properties.name: Pearl Market
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  804 NW 12th Ave, Portland, 97209Live in the Pearl and just want to run into a convenience store that is open later than usual? The Pearl market is open until 10pm every day except Sunday. There is no where else in the Pearl to get a litre of die coke on a whim after 9.

properties.name: Portland Institute for Contemporary Art
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr

properties.name: Prescott bank to rail
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr10410 NE Prescott St Portland, ORYou have to push about 20 times to get speed for this one. Good luck!!

properties.name: Qwanoes Camp
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr1350 Adelaide St. Crofton, BCWhere Yong spent every summer for nearly 15 years.

properties.name: Red Tail GC
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrTHIS IS NOT PROGRESS DOWNS ANYMORE!!!!!!!A challenging course that plays tough particulary on the greens. One of the not many bent grass gc\'\'s around (greens), they get VERY quick in the summer and are quite undulating. Other than that, keep the ball below the hole and you will shoot well.

properties.name: Rose City G.C.
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrWhat kind of golf course doesnt have a driving range?One of four (the worst) municipal golf courses in Portland. Heron Lakes being the best. You will find NO range here so just do a bunch of windmills in the parking lot and keep your fingers crossed. Oh yeah, everyone who goes here smokes like chimneys in the pro shop so everything, including your burger at the turn, is infused with the scent of nicotine. Watch out for golfers with out shirts. SCARY!!!!!

properties.name: Running group starts here!!! - Tullys
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr   1323 NW 23rd PortlandEvery Sunday morning at 8:30am a group of dedicated runners (L. Vollum, W. Bennington, and others) meet here for coffee and a run that proceeds to washington park, wildwood trail, to pittock, and down cornell. Round trip 1 hr 45 minutes or so. Please join us!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

properties.name: Saucebox
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 214 Sw Broadway, Portland, ORSince 1995, Saucebox has provided Portland amazing pan asian inspired cuisine, cocktails, and nightlife. With the additional dining room added on new years of 2005, there is even more room for you to enjoy.

properties.name: Skateable kidney pool
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr When dry this is a pretty gnarly pool but definitely shreddable.

properties.name: THE place to stay in TULUM
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrCabanas La ConchitaWe stayed here for 5 nights in December of 2003 and had the most amazing time. Except when I almost dies snorkeling and had to be saved by our snorkel guide.

properties.name: The Gorge Amphitheatre
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr    754 Silica Road N.W. 98848An awesome place to see a concert. Check out the view!!!! Concerts? we saw David Bowie and Tiesto!!!!!

properties.name: The Works 2005
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr Home of TBA festival and 2005 Dada Ball. Nightly meeting spot for dining, performances, concerts, and socializing. Pic include a performance by dj Spooky, friends, and family.

properties.name: Tigard Theatre Banks
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  11626 SW Pacific Hwy. Tigard, OR 97223During construction of the theatre, we often skated it at night with the help of large halogen lights. In one of the theatres there was a wide smooth bank that now goes up to the movie screen. We skated this for about a month in the late 80\'\'s.

properties.name: Tower Records - West Hollywood
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr8801 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069Open late, and also host to meet and greets. Pic courtesy of bennington of Pet Shop Boys in 2000.

properties.name: Widmer Brothers Brewery and Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  Home of Widmer brewery, one of Oregon\'\'s more popular beers. Popular location for Monday night happy hour! Yes, those are beer goggles.

properties.name: World Cup - the only place to buy coffee
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr  So its after 8pm and you just want a cup of coffee and you are in the pearl? This is the only place you can go to find coffee after everywhere else is closed.

properties.name: bluehour
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 250 NW 13th Ave, Portland, OROne of the best restaurants in Portland. Opened in 2000, it features mediterranean cuisine prepared by chef Kenny Giambalvo.

properties.name: can you do a 360?
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 8815 NE Glisan Street, Portland, OR 97220I did... and also performed a mute 180 on the vert ramp. Open on various days for skateboarding and spiritual matters.

properties.name: cinderblock wall at Burnside Skatepark
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr

properties.name: handrails in front of adidas us hq
properties.description: Posted by IoftigrPic circa 1987.

properties.name: home of william
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 1314 NW Irving 97209my home! Check out the view from my window!

properties.name: l'heure bleu
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr Private dining room of bluehour. Created in 2003 by designer William Bennington and restauranteur Bruce Carey, it is available for private parties and events.

properties.name: multnomah art center
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 6820 SW 45th Ave 97219 Multnomah Art Center Old skateboard spot. Perfect tall manual "stage".

properties.name: old skate spot - did my first wall ride off the ground.
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr Undercover area with the smoothes cement. Tall ceilings. Perfect for large launches with bball dunk option.

properties.name: worst golf hole of my life
properties.description: Posted by Ioftigr 4805 SW 229th, Aloha, OR 97007In US Amateur qualifier at this hole with my Dad as caddie, I hit 3 balls off the hozel into the gorge in front of the tee in a row, scored a 10 on the hole and wanted to shrink into a cup and die. Funny what nerves can do to you.
